monster.name: Gaea Trout (Stormchaser)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Gaea is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, message, shocking grasp • 1st level (4 slots): comprehend languages, mage armor, shield, silent image • 2nd level (2 slots): blur, enlarge/reduce

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Gaea has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Lucky
trait.text: When Gaea rolls a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, she can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

reaction.name: Portent
reaction.text: Gaea has two portent dice which are d20s and are rolled at the end of a long rest. She can replace any attack roll, skill check, or saving throw made by herself or a creature she can see with one of these dice.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, shocking grasp, comprehend languages, mage armor, shield, silent image, blur, enlarge/reduce

monster.name: Toosday Embers (Stormchaser)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Toosday is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Wisdom is his spelcasting ability. He has the following ranger spells prepared:
• 1st level (3 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, hunter's mark, protection from evil and good

trait.name: Planar Warrior
trait.text: Toosday's attacks ignore damage resistances and also deal an extra 1d6 force damage (included in the description).

trait.name: Natural Explorer
trait.text:
Toosday's explorational training have given him the following benefits:
• Toosday ignores difficult terrtain. • Toosday has advantage on initiative rolls. • On the first round of combat, Toosday has advantage on attacks made against creatures that have not taken a yet acted.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: Toosday has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

monster.spells: animal friendship, cure wounds, hunter's mark, protection from evil and good

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the panther moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.name: Awilo Nefasi, the Greater Storm Elemental
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Air Form
trait.text: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Body of the Storm
trait.text:
A strong wind blows around the elemental in a 10 foot radius, confering the following effects:
• Unprotected flames in that area are extinguished. • The area is difficult terrtain for all other creatures. • Ranged weapon attack rolls have disadvantage if they pass in or out of the range.

trait.name: Heart of the Storm
trait.text: A creature attempting to leave the storm's space must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw.

trait.name: Rage of the Storm
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn in the elemental's space takes 4 (1d8) lightning damage and 4 (1d8) thunder damage.

trait.name: Seige Monster
trait.text: The elemental does double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ball Lightning (Recharge 6)
action.text: The elemental summons 2 (1d4) Motes of Lightning in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet.

action.name: Disperse
action.text: The elemental becomes invisible until it uses an action to return to normal. While invisible in this way, the elemental's traits Body of the Storm, Heart of the Storm, and Rage of the Storm are inactive.

action.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 40 feet away from the elemental and knocked prone. If a Thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was Thrown. If the target is Thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

reaction.name: Storm Surge
reaction.text: When a creature comes within 5 feet of the elemental, it can cause that creature to attempt a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failure, that creature is pulled 5 feet into the elemental's space.

monster.description:
Rage Unbound, Power Unprecedented. Whether he began his life as a normal air elemental or was created with this much power is unknown. Awilo Nefasi displays higher intelligence than other air elementals, but, that intelligence comes with a price: cold, unbridled fury. Awilo Nefasi is known for flying into destructive rages
Absent Ambition. Although he is powerful enough to command his own retinue of air elementals and act as a Major Lord on the Elemental Plane of Air, Awilo Nefasi is content to serve his life as a brute. He has worked in the employ of much of the nobility at one point or another. It's become something of an unspoken rule that one can only enlist the services of the storm for a quarter-century or so before selling him off to another.
Eye of the storm It is common knowledge on the Elemental Plane of Air that at the center of even the most endlessly raging of storms there is a place of silence, peace and serenity. If the same can be said of Awilo Nefasi, anyone who's ever tried to find it has paid a hefty price.
Father of Sparks. Awilo Nefasi's ability to generate other elementals is something of an oddity. He takes note of this trait only in that it aids him in combat, providing him with allies. These creations do not live long lives, even if they survive the combat. After merely a few hours they fizzle into balls of plasma, leaving the slight scent of ozone on the air.
Source: Stormchasers (u/Selachian) (Homebrew)

monster.name: Mote of Lightning
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Air Form
trait.text: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Electrostatic Cloud
trait.text: At the start of each of the mote's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) lightning damage. A Large or smaller creature damaged this way must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save or become stunned until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Shock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) lightning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

monster.description:
Experts believe the mote is a juvenile air elemental, though this has never been proven. What is known is that these volatile creatures are malicious in intent and when a large amount of them gather, they can generate enough power to change the weather.
Cloud of Electricity. Resembling little more than wisps of cloud and vapour, the body of the mote is barely visible, and even when viewed clearly seems to be little more than smoke. The air around the mote crackles with energy, and occasionally short arcs of lighting will shoot from it.
Source: Stormchasers (u/Selachian) (Homebrew)
